meanings.definition: To park a vehicle again in a different location.
meanings.sent1: After lunch, I had to repark my car to find a better spot.
meanings.sent2: I will repark the car closer to the entrance for convenience.
meanings.sent3: Trying to repark in a crowded lot felt like a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts seemed to repark like cars in a busy city.
meanings.sent5: The driver had to repark multiple times to fit into the tight space.

meanings.definition: To move a parked vehicle to a different spot.
meanings.sent1: He decided to repark the truck to avoid a parking ticket.
meanings.sent2: Please repark the car to make space for others.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to repark itself on the warm hood of the car.
meanings.sent4: The idea seemed to repark in his mind, finding a new perspective.
meanings.sent5: The students had to repark their bicycles due to the sudden rain.
